employeeID = #{employeeid,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
leader = #{leader,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
kpi = #{kpi,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
comments = #{comments,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
check_date = #{checkDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update employee_kpi set employeeID = #{employeeid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, leader = #{leader,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, kpi = #{kpi,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, comments = #{comments,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, check_date = #{checkDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select count(0) from employee_kpi where 1=1
AND employee_kpi.employeeID like concat('%',#{employeeID},'%')
AND employee_kpi.kpi like concat('%',#{kpi},'%')
AND employee_kpi.leader like concat('%',#{leader},'%')

select
from employee_kpi where 1=1
AND employee_kpi.employeeID like concat('%',#{employeeID},'%')
AND employee_kpi.kpi like concat('%',#{kpi},'%')
AND employee_kpi.leader like concat('%',#{leader},'%')
limit #{queryNumber,jdbcType=INTEGER},#{StepSize,jdbcType=INTEGER}
